articles.title: How migrating Australian moths find caves hundreds of miles away - NPR
articles.description: Billions of nocturnal Bogong moths migrate up to 1,000 km to cool caves in the Australian Alps that they have never previously visited. New research shows how they may find their way there and back.
articles.content:
The Bogong moths of Australia aren't much to look at, says Andrea Adden
, a neurobiologist at the Francis Crick Institute. "They're small brown moths with arrow-like markings on the wings. They're p… [+4135 chars]
